document.type.description:
(Required) Document type.

For payment create you need provide name of form, depends on the system configuration. Example: ACC_TO_ACC_ANY

If you don't fill this parameter in the request, then "EXTERNAL" will be filled by server

document.field[name=subtype].description:
(Required) Subtype. If form have subtype, then you need provide it. Depends on the system configuration.

Example:

ACC_TO_ACC_INBANK - inbank payment;
ACC_TO_ACC_SEPA - SEPA payment
But if form not have subtype, then don’t provide this parameter in request

document.field[name=currency].description:
Payment currency.

3-digit alphabetic currency code, example EUR

document.field[name=source_currency].description:
Source currency.

3-digit alphabetic currency code, example EUR

document.field[name=target_currency].description:
Target currency.

3-digit alphabetic currency code, example EUR

document.field[name=amount].description:
Amount.

Amount in transaction currency.

Number of characters after the dot must correspond to the dimension of the currency

document.field[name=source_amount].description:
Source amount.

Amount in transaction currency.

Number of characters after the dot must correspond to the dimension of the currency

document.field[name=target_amount].description:
Target amount.

Amount in transaction currency.

Number of characters after the dot must correspond to the dimension of the currency

document.field[name=ben_country].description:
Beneficiary country.

XX - two-letter country code. Example: GB

customer.id.description:
Customer ID. Same as at the customer's structure (hmdcustomer id)

For payment create, one of the fields must be filled:

customer.id or customer.hmdcustomerreference.type.BACKOFFICE

customer.hmdcustomerreference.type.BACKO.description:
Customer backoffice reference.

For payment create, one of the fields must be filled:

customer.id or customer.hmdcustomerreference.type.BACKOFFICE

user.id.description:
User ID. Same as at the user's structure (hmduser id)

If user.id is not specified, the current user will be recorded in the payment (user who makes the request)

    </doc>
</response>
